issue.title: Release 7.0.0 - December 2023

labels.name: P1
labels.description: I'll work on this now. (Assignee required)

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
# Status of Bazel 7.0.0

-   Expected first release candidate date: October 17, 2023
-   Expected final release candidate date: December 6, 2023
-   Expected release date: December 11, 2023
-   [List of release blockers](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/milestone/55)

To report a release-blocking bug, please add a comment with the text `@bazel-io flag` to the issue. A release manager will triage it and add it to the milestone.

To cherry-pick a mainline commit into 7.0.0, simply send a PR against the `release-7.0.0` branch. (This branch will be created in October.)

**Task list:**

-   [x] Pick release baseline: 0a2aac4e3c6f5ef98fc233e2ce83e44930edb188
-   [x] Create release candidate: https://releases.bazel.build/7.0.0/rc1/index.html
-   [x] Check [downstream projects](https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazel-at-head-plus-downstream/builds/3395)
-   [x] Create [draft release announcement](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1clxBctsjpei40wqqjwiU2EltTzsrf_kvZ4dJyZVqghM/edit#heading=h.oanqk3j2ty6c) <!-- Note that there should be a new Bazel Release Announcement document for every major release. For minor and patch releases, use the latest open doc. -->
-   [x] Push the release and notify package maintainers
-   [x] Update the documentation
-   [x] Push the blog post
-   [x] Update the [release page](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/)

body:
Looking at the [list of commits between rc3 and rc4](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/compare/release-7.0.0rc3...release-7.0.0rc4), it does seem there were quite a few execution-log-related commits (for example https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/c767aa4e02c80fd0a9174052d88f13d24c9cec96). cc @tjgq

To pinpoint where the problem is, @rsalvador it would be nice if you ran a [bazelisk bisect](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazelisk#--bisect) in your project, or alternatively make a minimal repro. Either would help us address this as quickly as possible.

There may be a problem with my machine/environment, the first build problem is now also happening with rc3.
Please don't take this issue into account for the release, I'll add more info once I can reproduce reliably and find a commit with bisect. Sorry about the confusion.

issue.title: [7.0.0] Build failures and internal errors when switching from 7.0.0rc3 to 7.0.0rc4

milestone.title: 7.0.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved before the 7.0.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body:
The first error:
```
ERROR: /Users/rsalvador/.../BUILD.bazel:3:17: modelbuilder generating srcjar modelbuilder_generated.srcjar failed: Exec failed due to IOException: /Users/rsalvador/.cache/bazel/b6de016d545fc335c6fe85486d422c54/execroot/core/bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-fastbuild/bin/ui-services-connection-models-api/modelbuilder_generated (No such file or directory)
```
happens because we have directory dependencies between actions and with `-- noincompatible_disallow_unsound_directory_outputs` the project still builds in 7.0.0, but it seems that the directory dependencies between actions are no taken into account. E.g. actions that depend on a directory are sometimes executed before the action that generates the directory. We fixed this error by removing `--noincompatible_disallow_unsound_directory_outputs` and properly using `ctx.actions.declare_directory()`. This error was not specific to rc4.

Regarding the internal error:
```
FATAL: bazel crashed due to an internal error. Printing stack trace:
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unrecoverable error while evaluating node 'ActionLookupData6{actionLookupKey=ConfiguredTargetKey{label=//tools/build/bazel/rules/lwc/js:bundle, config=BuildConfigurationKey[6aa701ced8cd3692bfda0c63eeb4de6bb53c8649464bf1688db8c6f5976ed915]}, actionIndex=6}' (requested by nodes 'ArtifactNestedSetKey[6]@774500339', 'ArtifactNestedSetKey[5]@1662963755')
```
bazelisk bisect found that it is due to this commit: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/c4560822cc9d48f6642fd946ae0eac93a40668cc, the error occurs during builds using `--execution_log_json_file`

@rsalvador We have found another regression in Gerrit Code Review build machinery, that was hard to reproduce due to Bazel caching. I had to wipe out the whole cache entirely.

See this [issue](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/20262) for more details.
